content: I'm looking for the latest .NET API source code on https://github.com/ewoutkramer/fhir-net-api that matches the current build on http://build.fhir.org (version 1.9.0) I cannot find the matching branch
@Berry Bentlage the STU3 version of the .NET API is currently under development and is scheduled to be released before the HL7 WGM in May.

Yes, as the version on build.fhir.org is a CI build, trying to keep up with that might be a little challenging.
We do keep up with each connetathon build (last being the jan-2017 branch off STU3 - 1.8) and next will be once the STU3 published version goes out, expected in the next month or so
@Berry Bentlage, you can watch the progress by monitoring the "develop-stu3" branche in that repo....

Yes, this STU3 version of the API is looking pretty good. No NuGet packages yet, still going through its internal testing before we do that.
So if you want to try it out, please do grab that. It will be loaded into my STU3 server very soon.

Thanks for providing this repo. I'm getting solution load errors in Visual Studio 2015 when opening Hl7.Fhir.sln. It seems that Visual Studio 2017 is needed. Is this correct or is there a way to open and build in Visual Studio 2015?
Yes, that is correct - as we want to target dotnet core/netstandard we needed to switch to VS2017RC4.
Oh, and for now, there is one caveat: you need to run msbuild -t:BeforeBuild explicitly, I have no idea why this step is not run automatically.
(you need to do this only once unless you start meddling with the stuff in the /data directory of the Specification project)
I noticed the FHIR STU3 NuGet packages are marked alpha. Any ETA on beta or is that it for the near future? We're doing our upgrade from 1.9.0 and I don't want to do it any more times than necessary.

We are continuing to work on the validation section of the assemblies and typically we will leave things in alpha/beta for a while until we've had experience with them in use and sure that its stable enough.
I already have it n my server and there are a few technical corrections coming through in the next few weeks. And we don't expect there to be large changes to the API, just bug fixing.
